theoryTitle: Sanji's True Motivation for the Suke Suke no Mi
theoryText: While Sanji claims he wanted the Clear-Clear Fruit to become a 'superhero,' fans theorized the real reason was for perverted purposes - specifically to spy on women bathing. This theory was confirmed in Episode 359 when Sanji admits his true motivation, though he tries to justify it.
author: One Piece Community

theoryTitle: Absalom's Devil Fruit Will Transfer to a Major Character
theoryText: Fans theorized that Absalom's Suke Suke no Mi would eventually be taken by another character, possibly through his death. This was confirmed post-timeskip when Shiryu of the Blackbeard Pirates obtained the fruit after Absalom was killed.
author: One Piece Community

theoryText: Fans theorized that while Moria's shadow clone Doppelman cannot take damage itself, attacking Moria directly when he's using it might force him to recall it for defense. This tactical weakness could be exploited by targeting both simultaneously.
author: Thriller Bark Arc Viewers

theoryTitle: Sanji's Devil Fruit Encyclopedia Knowledge Will Be Important
theoryText: The revelation that Sanji studied a Devil Fruit Encyclopedia as a child led fans to theorize that this knowledge would become crucial later in the series, potentially helping identify rare or unknown fruits, or revealing connections to his mysterious past.
author: One Piece Theory Community
source: Fan forums and YouTube theory videos

theoryTitle: The Thriller Bark Battles Mirror Final War Roles
theoryText: Some fans theorized that the separated battles in Thriller Bark (Luffy vs Moria, Sanji vs Absalom, Usopp vs Perona, etc.) foreshadow each Straw Hat's role in the final war, with each facing opponents that challenge their specific abilities and values.
author: Arc Analysis Community
source: One Piece analysis blogs and forums

theoryText: Fans theorized that Kumashi might have belonged to Perona when he was alive, or that his shadow comes from someone who deeply cared for her. This would explain his exceptional loyalty compared to other Wild Zombies.
author: Character Analysis Fans
